body: It's tempting to think of either a "go vet" check, or something that the compiler might do automatically, since a pattern along the lines of "go pointer -> unsafe.Pointer -> uintptr -> cgo call arg & go pointer is now not live" is a red flag with a siren.  *I'd* want a tool like that to make it easier to deal with bugs like this, might as well cut out the middle man and put it into go vet or the compiler itself.
